results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Bill Reid
results.brief_description: Here, in cinema verite style, film is used as a means of letting a family look in on itself, at the differences of outlook, lifestyle and values that separate the parents and two grown sons. Completely unrehearsed, it is a record on film, of a few days’ visit back home on the part of the older son (the filmmaker) and of the conversations that took place among the four in a genuine though abortive attempt to reach mutual understanding. The film is an example of the communications barrier that divides many families.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Bill Reid

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Jerome Hellman, United Artists Corporation and Hal Ashby
results.brief_description: A lonely army wife (Jane Fonda), whose husband is serving in Vietnam, falls in love with a paralysed veteran (Jon Voight) she meets while working as a volunteer in the Army base hospital. An unusually mature examination of the effect of the Vietnam War on the lives of American servicemen. Winner of Academy Awards for Fonda and Voight. Based on a story by Nancy Dowd.

results.title: Comic relief
results.creator_credit: Comic Relief, BBC-TV, Ed Bye, Richard Curtis, Roger Graef, Philip Chilvers, Paul Jackson and Geoff Posner
results.brief_description: A live show to fight famine in Ethiopia and the Sudan, recorded on April 4, 5, 6 1986 at the Shaftesbury Theatre, London (home of the theatre of comedy) featuring some of Britain’s top comedians and entertainers including Rowan Atkinson, Billy Connolly, French and Saunders, Stephen Fry, Kate Bush, Ben Elton, Bob Geldof, Rick Mayall, Cliff Richard, Midge Ure, Spitting Image and more. NB: Uncensored and includes material which some people may find offensive.

results.title: Comforting your fussy baby (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child Health Series -Revised”.
This short film shows how parents should respond to the needs of their baby, particularly one which cries a lot. Emphasises the importance of tender loving care, and play.

results.title: Comets: time capsules of the solar system
results.creator_credit: Media Four Productions, Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description: Animation sequences are combined with live footage to explore the role comets play in contemporary science research about the solar system’s beginnings. Shows how man’s knowledge of comets has evolved from superstitious fear to a growing understanding of their composition and structure.
results.title_for_label: Comets: time capsules of the solar system

results.title: Comet
results.brief_description: Uses animation and appropriate commentary to explain the effect and influence of comets upon the planet Earth. Examines the knowledge of comets over the centuries and spends some time discussing Halley’s comet.
results.description: Uses animation and appropriate commentary to explain the effect and influence of comets upon the planet Earth. Examines the knowledge of comets over the centuries and spends some time discussing Halley’s comet.

results.title: Comedy greats: Peter Cooke & Dudley Moore
results.brief_description: This film is a collection of some of the infectious comic skits conceived and performed by Peter Cook and Dudley Moore that were to influence and inspire a generation of performers with their fresh and innovative style. Collected from their landmark 60’s TV show, “Not only but also”, this video samples some of the best, to include; Bo Dudley, The Leaping Nuns, Roger and Sir discussing ‘the opposite number and how Roger came to be’, the moving life story of acclaimed Finnish film star of the 30’s Bargo (aka Anna Nigma), Pete and Dud discussing how they’ve rejected a host of screen sirens from Betty Grable to Anna Magnani. Including many other skits, they particularly enjoy poking fun at the film industry and the art world in general. Their repartee and affection for each other is obvious, especially when together they employ a number of techniques to prevent themselves from laughing, including stuffing their mouths with food.

results.title: Comedies. 1st 20 years. Part 4: 1908-1912 (D.W. Griffith)
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent comedy motion pictures directed by D.W. Griffith and restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.
Contents: Balked at the altar (1908)—Faithful (1910)—A Dash through the clouds (1912)
